business.headline: NPCI issues clarification on 'Jumped Deposit Scam.' 3 key things to knowNPCI debunks 'Jumped Deposit Scam' fears, urging UPI users to stay alert and trust in the platform's robust security.

Sensex nosedives 900 points. Decoding today's stock market bloodbathThe Sensex was down 879.56 points to 76,499.35 at 1:56 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 300 points lower at 23,131.50. All the other broader market indices were trading in negative territory as volatility skyrocketed during the afternoon trading session.

Want to get your credit card's annual fee waived? Follow these stepsMany banks offer ways to waive credit card annual fees by meeting specific spending thresholds, allowing you to enjoy benefits without extra costs.

Trading platform Groww plans IPO at $6-8 billion valuation: ReportIf successful, Groww's listing will mark the first IPO by a digital trading platform in India, adding a new chapter to the rapidly expanding fintech landscape.

Laxmi Dental IPO: Should you bid for the Rs 698.06 crore public listing? Laxmi Dental IPO will remain open for subscription until January 15, 2024 with allotment for shares expected to be completed on January 16, 2025.

Boss bought Lamborghini, thanked our 90-hour workweek: Investor adds to L&T memesL&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan recently sparked controversy with his proposal of a 90-hour workweek and working on Sundays.

HCLTech share price flat ahead of Q3 earnings. What to expect?HCLTech share price and Q3 results: The IT giant is set to report its quarterly results with expectations of a modest rise in profit and revenue despite challenges in key business segments.

HCLTech to announce Q3 results today: What to expect from the IT giant HCLTech Q3 results preview: Market analysts predict that HCLTech will show robust growth in the December quarter, driven by its software business and recent acquisition of the Communications Technology Group (CTG).

Sensex down nearly 800 points. 3 things stock market investors should knowStock market today: The Sensex hit an intraday low of 76,535.24 during the trading session, and was down 744.23 points to 76,634.67 at around 1:01 pm. At the same time, the Nifty50 was trading 246.80 points lower at 23,184.70.

Budget 2025: Government may raise minimum EPS pension to Rs 7,500The government might consider raising the minimum EPS pension to Rs 7,500, potentially bringing long-awaited relief to retirees in Budget 2025.

Adani Wilmar share price falls 8% to hit 52-week low. Here's why Adani Wilmar stock: Market cap of Adani Wilmar stood at Rs 35,494.22 crore. The stock has fallen 15.88% in the past week, 18.31% in the last 6 months, and 24.94% in the past year.

Rupee hits all-time low of 86/USD. Will it decline further?The rupee slipped 0.4% to a record low of 86.39 per dollar. Check the key factors behind this decline and whether the Indian currency faces further challenges.

Standard Glass Lining IPO lists at 23% premium over IPO price on Dalal Street Standard Glass Lining listing: Shares listed at Rs 172 per share on the NSE, marking a premium of 22.86% over the IPO price, which was set in the range of Rs 133 to Rs 140 per share.

Explained: Why Biocon share price climbed over 4% in early trade todayBiocon's share price climbed to an intraday high of Rs 377.50 per share in intraday trade on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). As of 10:23 am, Biocon's stock was trading at Rs 376.60 per share, up 4.34% on the BSE.

Budget 2025: Experts push for HRA inclusion, Rs 1 lakh standard deduction Amid rising costs and squeezed disposable incomes, the spotlight is on the new tax regime, with experts pushing the demands for HRA inclusion and a Rs 1 lakh standard deduction in Budget 2025.

Rupee falls to all-time low of 86 against US dollar, likely to remain volatileRupee hits all-time low: For the Indian economy, the sustained pressure on the rupee could translate to higher import costs and a potential rise in inflation.

Sensex falls over 600 points: Why is stock market down today? 3 key reasonsStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 657.97 points to 76,720.94, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 199.60 points to 23,231.90 as of 9:20 AM.

Stricter US sanctions threaten Russia's oil trade with India and China: Report The new sanctions are likely to severely affect Russia's oil exports, as many tankers previously used for shipments to India and China will now face restrictions.

Standard Glass Lining IPO listing: Shares to make strong market debut? Check GMPStandard Glass Lining share price: The IPO was open for subscription from January 6 to 8, offering shares in a price band of Rs 133-140 with a lot size of 107 shares.

Stocks to watch today: Adani Green Energy, Ola Electric, DMart, HCLTechKey stocks likely to be in focus include Adani Green Energy, Ola Electric, DMart, HCLTech, Angel One, and others due to various announcements, news updates, and quarterly results.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: PM opens key Z-Morh Tunnel in Jammu and Kashmir's Sonamarg in big tourism boostPM Modi inaugurated the Z-Morh tunnel on Monday. Built at a cost of Rs 2,700-crore, this tunnel will provide an all-weather connectivity between Srinagar and Sonamarg in Jammu and Kashmir.

You've dragged your feet: Court slams Delhi government for delaying CAG reportThe Delhi High Court said that the AAP government "dragged its feet" to prevent the Assembly session from taking place so that the tabling of the CAG report could be delayed.

Maha Kumbh Mela, humanity's largest gathering, begins in PrayagrajMahakumbh Mela 2025: The 45-day Maha Kumbh, happening after a gap of 144 years, will witness the participation of over 45 crore devotees, including nearly 15 lakh from foreign nations.
Launch of Jeff Bezos's New Glenn rocket postponed due to anomalyThe New Glenn rocket, which stands at an impressive 320 feet tall, is designed to be Blue Origin's flagship heavy-lift vehicle.

How Yogi Adityanath is charting own course on Hindutva heritageThere are two streams of thought in the larger Hindutva family when it comes to the disputed places of worship. With his stance that "reclaiming heritage is not a bad thing", Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has charted a distinct course, different from RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat's.

Sensex nosedives over 1,000 points. Decoding today's stock market bloodbathThe Sensex was down 1041.18 points to 76,337.73 at 2:50 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 329.70 points lower at 23,101.80. All the other broader market indices were trading in negative territory as volatility skyrocketed during the afternoon trading session.

From boosting defence logistics to tourism, here's why Z-Morh Tunnel is importantThe project, completed at a cost of over Rs 2,700 crore, also features a parallel 7.5-meter-wide parallel escape tunnel for enhanced safety. It significantly reduces travel time between Srinagar and Sonamarg.

Cricketer Abhishek Sharma shreds IndiGo: 1-day holiday completely ruinedCricketer Abhishek Sharma lashed out at the popular airline, saying its staff misbehaved with him at the Delhi airport on Monday, January 13. Abhishek said he had only a day's holiday to spend with his close ones before he headed to Kolkata for the opening match of a T20I series against England.

Maha Kumbh 2025: When to visit, where to stayThe 45-day Maha Kumbh Mela 2025 in Prayagraj, a once-in-144-year spiritual gathering, commenced on January 13. The congregation is expected to draw 450 million devotees to the Triveni Sangam. Visitors can choose to visit on the six auspicious bathing days or opt for less-crowded dates. Here are the various accommodation options, ranging from tent cities and luxury hotels to budget lodges.

In new BJP poster, Arvind Kejriwal is 'Mogambo', AAP hits back with spoof video Delhi Election: The Delhi BJP released a poster portraying AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal as Mogambo. AAP hit back with its own satirical take, spoofing a scene from the 1996 Ajay Devgn starrer 'Diljale'.

Australian woman's son killed in Los Angeles fires, says 'there was no water'Recounting the terrifying scenes, the mother said that her son, suffering from cerebral palsy, was blind and had difficulty walking as the fire broke out.

Boss bought Lamborghini, thanked our 90-hour workweek: Investor adds to L&T memesL&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan recently sparked controversy with his proposal of a 90-hour workweek and working on Sundays.

Are crocodiles pretending to drown to bait and hunt humans? Here's the truthA video of a crocodile floating upside down and waving its forelimbs in Indonesia's Barito River has gone viral, with people claiming that it was faking distress to lure humans into the water and attack them. Have crocodiles evolved into such a level of cunning to hunt humans? Here's the truth.

Disney slapped with 10 billion dollar copyright lawsuit over Moana franchiseAnimator Buck Woodall has sued Disney for allegedly copying his screenplay for the movie Moana and its sequel, seeking 10 billion dollars in damages. The lawsuit claims Disney used elements from Woodall's project, Bucky, which shares similar themes and storylines.

Good Samaritans to get Rs 25,000 for helping accident victims: Nitin GadkariNitin Gadkari said that the current reward of Rs 5,000 for accident victims was not sufficient for the person who rushes road accident victims to hospitals in the crucial first hour of the accident.

China conducts drills near LAC in Eastern Ladakh, Indian forces on alert: SourcesHeaded by a regiment of the Chinese army's Xinjiang Military Command, the military exercise featured advanced military technology, including all-terrain vehicles, unmanned systems, drones, and exoskeletons designed to enhance soldier mobility and endurance.

Why Isro aborted the SpaDeX docking after bringing satellites closeThe latest attempt, which began just after midnight, saw Isro successfully narrow the distance between two satellites from 230 meters to 15 meters using the slow drift technique.

Maha Kumbh begins: How it has its roots in science and astronomyThis grand gathering attracts millions of pilgrims who seek spiritual cleansing through ritual bathing in sacred rivers, particularly the confluence of the Ganges, Yamuna, and the mythical Saraswati.

Parents visit IIT-Kharagpur to meet son, find him hanging in his roomA third-year Electrical Engineering student of IIT-Kharagpur was found dead inside his hostel room by his parents who had come to meet him. Police have launched a probe into the incident.

Comet visible tonight: Next time it returns none of us will be on EarthDiscovered on April 5, 2024, by the Asteroid Terrestrial-impact Last Alert System (ATLAS) in Chile, G3 ATLAS was initially faint, shining at a magnitude of +19.

Masaba Gupta names her daughter Matara, explains its significanceDesigner and actor Masaba Gupta has disclosed the name of her daughter in a new social media post. After revealing the child's name as Matara, Masaba also explained its meaning.

24 dead, 12,000 structures destroyed in Los Angeles fire amid race to douse blazeFirefighters raced to control the wildfires in Los Angeles, which has claimed 24 lives so far. Additionally, 16 people have been reported missing amid the ongoing crisis.

Drugged, gang-raped, burned alive: 5 cases reveal horror of UK grooming gangsProbes by counties and reports in the media reveal how grooming gangs run by Pakistani-origin men brutally tortured and gang-raped white girls as young as 11 in the UK. In one case, the victim was burned alive with her sister and mother. Here are five cases that reveal the extent of horror of these grooming gangs in the UK.

We are here for the comments on this viral pic of 'reverse vada pav'A photograph of a so-called 'reverse vada pav' — a fried potato vada stuffed inside a hollowed-out brioche bun — has gone viral on social media.

Nandamuri Balakrishna, Urvashi celebrate Daaku Maharaj success with a danceNandamuri Balakrishna and Urvashi Rautela's Daaku Maharaj opened to a positive reception in theatres. On Sunday, the duo celebrated the achievement by recreating the film's dance steps at a success party.

Coldplay concert in India: Fun facts about the British band you did not knowColdplay is set to mesmerise Indian fans with their upcoming concerts in Mumbai and Ahmedabad as part of their Music Of The Spheres World Tour. Here are a few fun facts about the group you did not know.

Rajinikanth's Baashha to re-release in theatres to mark 30th anniversarySuperstar Rajinikanth-starrer Baashha is expected to re-release in cinemas soon to mark three decades since the movie's release. The iconic feature had originally released in 1995.

Punjab 95: Diljit Dosanjh's Jaswant Singh Khalra biopic to release in FebruaryDiljit Dosanjh-starrer Punjab '95, based on human rights activist Jaswant Singh Khalra, may finally see a release in February after being stalled by the censor board for over a year.

sports.headline: Champions Trophy: South Africa announce squad, Stubbs-Rickleton rewardedSouth Africa announced their 15-member squad for the Champions Trophy on Monday, January 13. SA called-up Tony de Zorzi, Ryan Rickelton, Tristan Stubbs and Wiaan Mulder for their maiden ICC tournament.

2-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu signs multi-year deal with PumaPV Sindhu, two-time Olympic medallist and one of India's greatest sporting trailblazers, has joined forces with sports brand PUMA India in a multi-year partnership as brand ambassador.

Good night: Barcelona fan Kuldeep Yadav trolls Real Madrid after El ClasicoIndia spinner Kuldeep Yadav has trolled Real Madrid after they lost the Super Cup to FC Barcelona. Kuldeep, a Barcelona fan took to Twitter to express his joy.

Jannik Sinner continues hard-court love affair, Iga Swiatek marches onAustralian Open 2025: Despite ongoing chatter regarding doping sanctions, Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek made a winning start to their campaigns at Melbourne Park. Sinner extended his winning run at Grand Slam tournaments on hard courts to 15 matches.

Karun Nair equals record-feat in Vijay Hazare in bid to revive India careerVijay Hazare Trophy: Vidarbha captain Karun Nair equalled the record of Narayan Jagadeesan by hitting his 5th century of the tournament. Nair has been in terrific form and is pushing hard to revive his dormant India career.

Pat Cummins to lead as Australia announce 15-member squad for Champions TrophyAustralia have announced their 15-member preliminary squad for the Champions Trophy. Injured fast bowlers Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood have been named in the side.

Shreyas Iyer sets sight on winning maiden title for Punjab Kings as captainThe newly appointed captain of the Punjab Kings, Shreyas Iyer, has set his sights on winning maiden title for the franchise in the upcoming IPL 2025.

FA Cup: 10-man Manchester United, Bayindir dump Arsenal out on penaltiesAltay Bayindir was the star of the show as 10-man Manchester United defeated Arsenal 5-3 on penalties to dump them out of the FA Cup in the third round on Sunday, January 12. United fought bravely for most of the game as Diogo Dalot was given a red card.

Pakistan will have upper hand over India in Champions Trophy 2025: Mohammad AmirFormer Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Amir feels Pakistan will have an upper hand over India in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 due to their recent form.

Sabalenka defeated Sloanne Stephens in straight sets to make it to the second round.

PD Champions Trophy: Indian Physical Disability Team beat Pakistan by 109 runsNikhil Manhas was the star of the show as the Indian physical disability team defeated Pakistan by 109 runs on Sunday, January 12. India posted 160 runs in their 19 overs as Pakistan's chase faltered in just 12.2 overs.

Watch: Mohammad Nawaz and Tanzim Hasan get involved in physical fight in BPLMohammad Nawaz and Tanzim Hasan Sakib were seen getting involved in a physical fight during Bangladesh Premier League Match 17 between Sylhet Strikers and Khulna Tigers.

Australian Open 2025, Day 2 schedule: Sinner, Djokovic and Alcaraz begin campaignJannik Sinne, Carlos Alcaraz and Novak Djokovic will start their campaign on Day 2 of the Australian Open 2025 on Monday, January 12. Coco Gauff, Iga Swiatek and Naomi Osaka will also be in action on Monday in Melbourne.

IPL to follow ICC's Code of Conduct regulations from 2025 seasonIPL 2025 to align with the ICC's Code of Conduct, enforcing global playing standards for disciplinary actions. Meanwhile, the Women's Premier League will feature matches in Lucknow, Mumbai, Baroda, and Bengaluru, showcasing a landmark season for women's cricket in India.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
